meta_description: Visit Illinois Holocaust Museum presents Experience360 to learn about civil rights, genocide, and its impact across history.
hours_text:
# Plan Your Visit

Now open in downtown Chicago, **Illinois Holocaust Museum presents Experience360** : _A Panoramic View Through History and Time_ , a pop-up museum featuring the best of IHMEC’s unique and innovative exhibits. Here, you will learn about the Holocaust and other genocides through the stories of survivors, ‘converse’ with survivor Holograms, and experience the hope within humanity that shines in history’s darkest hours. 

**Free Days are back at the Museum on the last Wednesday of the month. The next upcoming Free Day is January 28.**

#### Location

Experience360 is located at 360 N. State Street (at Kinzie), Chicago, IL 60654.

#### Hours of Operation

  * Experience360 will be open seven days a week from 10:00 a.m. through 5:00 p.m.
  * On the **first Wednesdays of the month** , **Experience360 will be open from 10:00 a.m. through 8:00 p.m.**
  * Our Skokie Museum is currently closed for renovations. Click here to learn more about our [construction](https://www.ilholocaustmuseum.org/museum-announces-renovations-and-new-chicago-location/).

#### Ticket Pricing

**ADMISSION PRICE** | **MEMBERS** | **NON-MEMBERS**  
---|---|---  
Adults | Free | $12.00  
Seniors (65+) | Free | $8.00  
Students (up to age 22 with valid student ID) | Free | $8.00  
Children (5-11) | Free | $6.00  
Children (Under 5) | Free | Free  
  
#### 

#### **Holiday Schedule**

The Museum will be closed on the following days in 2026:

  * **January 1st** , Museum closed for New Year’s Day

accessibility_text:
# Accessibility at the Museum

_Accessibility initiatives at Illinois Holocaust Museum & Education Center are generously supported by Gerald and Olivia Shapiro._

We want each visitor to have a memorable experience at our Museum and we are committed to making our programs, exhibitions, and facilities accessible for everyone by removing accessibility barriers, delivering a welcoming and relevant experience, and providing opportunities for meaningful engagement.

For questions or feedback regarding accessibility, please contact **[info@ilhmec.org](mailto:info@ilhmec.org)** or **847.967.4800**.

## International Holocaust Remembrance Day - Tuesday, January 27th

This year’s Ellen V. & Philip L. Glass Holocaust Commemorative Series features Pieces of a Man: A Son's Reckoning with Memory and Survival. With raw honesty and sharp wit, David Labi shares the story of his father, a Libyan Jew who survived the Nazi camps as a child and later lived a life shaped by silence, survival, and storm. Join us for an evening of remembrance and reflection. 

[Reserve your spot today](https://tinyurl.com/yv647djt)
